question: Foot-and-Mouth disease in animals, a current epidemic in some parts of the world, is caused by which of the following microorganisms?
explanation: Foot and mouth disease, caused by Aphthovirus sp. in the family Picornaviridae, is an OIE listed reportable disease with major impact on livestock trade worldwide that can affect hedgehogs. Though not common, the risk of infection is great enough that an awareness of the lesions is warranted.
